metadata.title: CVE-2021-47006 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: ARM:9064/1: hw_breakpoint: Do not directly check the event's overflow_handlerhook The commit 1879445dfa7b ("perf/core: Set event's default::overflow_handler()") set a default event->overflow_handler inperf_event_alloc(), and replace the check event->overflow_handler withis_default_overflow_handler(), but one is missing. Currently, thebp->overflow_handler can not be NULL. As a result, enable_single_step() isalways not invoked. Comments from Zhen Lei:https://patchwork.kernel.org/project/linux-arm-kernel/patch/20210207105934.2001-1-thunder.leizhen@huawei.com/

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47006` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9

No subscription required
